name: YWPD-TC-307 - Verify that the user is able to create Test Program Level SWM Rule with Web Small -- @1.2

steps.name: Given The user successfully opened the yieldWerx web application and login
When Click on "SWM" in the left menu bar and click on SWM Rules
When Click on "New SWM Rule" button from SWM Rules window
When Create SWM Rules window will open so enter name as "4670-PrePostMerge-F-F - TestProgram" And description in "General" tab
When Click "Input Data Selection" And Select level as "Test Program"
When Select the Source Facility as "WEB SMALL DATASET", Source Work Center as "WAFER SORT"
When Select Source Device as "4670"
When Select Source Probe as "(1|M)" and Source Test Program as "PREBAKE_A_4670"
When Select Target Facility  as "WEB SMALL DATASET", Target Work Center  as "WAFER SORT
When Select Target Device as "4670"
When Select Target Test Program as "POSTBAKE_A_4670", Target Probe "(1|M)"
When Click the tab "Rule Definition" and Select rule Type from "BIN Rule" drop down
When Select the Die Exist in Wafers as "Die Exist in Both Source and Target Wafers"
When Select Source Wafer Bin as "Failing"
When Select Target Wafer Bin as "Failing"
When Select Combine Wafer Bin Details as "Target Wafer BIN"
When Give Hard Bin Number as "NA", Soft Bin Number as "NA"
When Select the Bin Flag and the other fields data
When Select the Die Type "NA"
When Select from "Both"
When Enable the following checkbox if required
When Click "Email Notification" tab
When Enter the valid "Owner Name", "Owner Email Address" and the Enter additional emails if needed
When Click the "Save" button
Then Verify that the test program level rule will be saved and appear in the SWM Rules window

parameters.name: Die Exist in Wafers
parameters.value: Die Exist in Both Source and Target Wafers

fullName: SWM Rules Test Program Level: YWPD-TC-307 - Verify that the user is able to create Test Program Level SWM Rule with Web Small
